subject: Investing
title: Compounding Dividends Over Decades
description: A quick, practical guide to Compounding Dividends Over Decades.

hook.text: $10,000 invested in dividend stocks with reinvestment in 1990 became over $200,000 by 2020.

buildup.text: Reinvesting dividends buys more shares, which generate more dividends, which buy even more shares.

discovery.text: This snowball effectâ€”compoundingâ€”is the single most powerful force in long-term wealth building.

twist.text: Over 40 years, reinvested dividends have accounted for roughly 85% of the S&P 500's total return.

climax.text: The key variables are time, growth rate, and consistency. Start early, reinvest, and don't interrupt the cycle.

punchline.text: Compounding is slow magic. Give it decades and it becomes unstoppable.
